required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bipolar Plasmakinetic TURP Vs Monopolar TURP in the Treatment of Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing Bipolar Plasmakinetic Transurethral Resection of the Prostate With Monopolar Transurethral Resection of the Prostate in the Treatment of Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms Due to Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized controlled trial with one-year follow-up comparing intra, peri and postoperative outcomes for plasmakinetic transurethral resection of prostate (PK-TURP) and monopolar transurethral resection of prostate (M-TURP) in the treatment of LUTS due to BPH in a tertiary-care public institution

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a randomized controlled trial with one-year follow-up comparing intra, peri and postoperative outcomes (efficacy, complications and sequelae) for plasmakinetic transurethral resection of prostate (PK-TURP) and monopolar transurethral resection of prostate (M-TURP) in the treatment of LUTS due to BPH in a tertiary-care public institution (Madrid, Spain)

primary_outcome.description: International Prostate Symptom Score (with 7 questions) at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months after surgery. Results: the sum of the 7 items will range between 0 to 35 points Interpretation: allows categorizing the lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) in 3 categories Mild LUTS: 0-7 points Moderate LUTS: 8-19 points Severe LUTS: 20-35 points
Maximum urinary flow rate (mL/s) at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months after surgery.
Postvoid residual urine volume (mL) was measured by abdominal ultrasound after urination at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QoL): Bother Score Item of the IPSS Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: We use the bother score item of the IPSS questionnaire (question 8) at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months after surgery to assess the quality of life (QoL) due to lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) Results: will range between 0 to 6 points Interpretation: allows categorizing the QoL in 3 categories Good QoL: 0-2 points Intermediate QoL: 3 points Poor QoL: 4-6points

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Sexual Activity in the Last Month
secondary_outcome.description: Measure Description: All patients were asked, Did you have sexual activity in the last month? Possible answers were yes or no. Possible answers: yes or no. Measurement moment: at 1, 3, 6 and 12 months after surgery.

International Index of Erectile Function (with 5 questions) at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months after surgery. Results: the sum of the 5 items will range between 1 to 25 points Interpretation: allows categorizing the erectile function of patients Without erectile dysfunction: 22-25 points Mild erectile dysfunction: 17-21 points Mild to moderate erectile dysfunction: 12-16 points Moderate erectile dysfunction: 8-11 points Severe erectile dysfunction: 1-7 points
Prostate volume was measured by transrectal ultrasound at 12 months after surgery
Operative time (min)
Irrigation volume (L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Plasmatic Sodium in 24 Hours Post-operation
secondary_outcome.description: Compared with the baseline, to demonstrate the sodium loss during operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Haemoglobin in 24 Hours Post-operation
secondary_outcome.description: Compared with the baseline, to demonstrate the blood loss during operation
Number of participants requiring blood transfusion during, expressed in %
Catheter duration (days)
Hospital stay (days)
Resected tissue weigh (grams)
Compared with the baseline, to demonstrate the % of tissue loss during operation
Speed resection (g/min)
The ratio of patient who need reoperation because bleeding complications
The ratio of patient who need reoperation because residual adenoma or complications
Post-transurethral resection of the prostate syndrome rate was recorded.

It is a system for evaluating surgical complications at 12 months after surgery. Clavien I Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions. Acceptable therapeutic regimens are drugs as antiemetics, antipyretics, analgesics, diuretics and electrolytes, and physiotherapy. Clavien II Requiring pharmacological treatment with drugs other than such allowed for grade I complications. Blood transfusions and total parenteral nutrition are also included Clavien III - Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention Clavien IV - Life-threatening complication (including central nervous system complications) requiring intensive care unit management Clavien V - Death of a patient
Register the number of events of haematuria and acute urinary retention by clots
Register the number of urinary tract infections at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months after surgery.
Register the number of meatal stenosis at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.
Register the number of urethral stricture at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stenotic Complications Rate: Bladder Neck Contracture
secondary_outcome.description: Register the number of bladder neck contracture at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.
Register the number of patients with stress urinary incontinence at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Urge Urinary Incontinence With Need for Drug Use (UUIND) Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Register the number of patients with urge urinary incontinence with need for drug use at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Urge Urinary Incontinence Without Need for Drug Use (UUIWND) Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Register the number of patients with urge urinary incontinence without need for drug use at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.
register the number of retrograde ejaculation at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.
register the number of dysuria at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

arm_group.description: The M-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Olympus or Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (Glycine 1.5%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (ForceTriadTM, Medtronic) and a stainless steel loop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (120W) prostate tissue and cauterize (80W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator

The PK-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (NaCl 0.9%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (PlasmaKineticTM Superpulse de Gyrus, ACMI) and a platinum-iridium superloop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (180W) prostate tissue and cauterize (100W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator

intervention.description: Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sign the informed consent voluntarily and will be willing to follow-up
- Prostate volume <80 g
- Meet any conditions (1) Diagnose of LUTS due to refractory to drugs BPH. (2) presenting complications derived from BPH (bladder calculi, recurrent haematuria, recurrent urinary tract infections, acute urinary retention)
- The use of antiplatelet agents or anticoagulant drugs is allowed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous history of pelvic surgery
- Previous history of pelvic radiotherapy
- Previous history of neurogenic bladder dysfunction
- Documented or suspected prostate carcinoma
- Patients with severe cardiopulmonary disease or severe mental disorders
- Poor compliance, and can not be followed up.

reference.citation: Ahyai SA, Gilling P, Kaplan SA, Kuntz RM, Madersbacher S, Montorsi F, Speakman MJ, Stief CG. Meta-analysis of functional outcomes and complications following transurethral procedures for lower urinary tract symptoms resulting from benign prostatic enlargement. Eur Urol. 2010 Sep;58(3):384-97. doi: 10.1016/j.eururo.2010.06.005. Epub 2010 Jun 11. Review.

Cornu JN, Ahyai S, Bachmann A, de la Rosette J, Gilling P, Gratzke C, McVary K, Novara G, Woo H, Madersbacher S. A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis of Functional Outcomes and Complications Following Transurethral Procedures for Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms Resulting from Benign Prostatic Obstruction: An Update. Eur Urol. 2015 Jun;67(6):1066-1096. doi: 10.1016/j.eururo.2014.06.017. Epub 2014 Jun 25. Review.

results_reference.citation: Otaola-Arca H, Álvarez-Ardura M, Molina-Escudero R, Fernández MI, Páez-Borda Á. A prospective randomized study comparing bipolar plasmakinetic transurethral resection of the prostate and monopolar transurethral resection of the prostate for the treatment of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia: efficacy, sexual function, Quality of Life, and complications. Int Braz J Urol. 2021 Jan-Feb;47(1):131-144. doi: 10.1590/S1677-5538.IBJU.2019.0766.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: M-TURP
group.description: The M-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Olympus or Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (Glycine al 1.5%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (ForceTriadTM, Medtronic) and a stainless steel loop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (120W) prostate tissue and cauterize (80W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: IPSS
measure.description: IPSS = International Prostate Symptom Score Interpretation: Is the sum of the 7 items Scale range: between 0 to 35 units on the scale Higher values represent a worse outcome Subcategories: allows categorizing the lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) in three categories 0-7 units on the scale: Mild LUTS 8-19 units on the scale: Moderate LUTS 20-35 units on the scale: Severe LUTS

measure.title: QoL score
measure.description: QoL = Quality of Life Interpretation: Is the value of item 8 of the IPSS questionnaire Scale range: between 0 to 6 units on the scale Higher values represent a worse outcome Subcategories: allows categorizing the QoL in three categories 0-2 units on the scale: Good QoL 3 units on the scale: Intermediate QoL 4-6 units on the scale: poor QoL

measure.title: Number of Participants Reporting Sexual Activity in the Last Month
measure.description: All patients were asked, Did you have sexual activity in the last month? Possible answers: yes/no

measure.title: IIEF score
measure.description: IIEF = International Index of Erectile Function Interpretation: Is the sum of the 5 items of the questionnaire Scale range: between 1 to 25 units on the scale Higher values represent a better outcome Subcategories: allows categorizing the erectile function of patients: 22-25 units on the scale: Without erectile dysfunction 17-21 units on the scale: Mild erectile dysfunction 12-16 units on the scale: Mild to moderate erectile dysfunction 8-11 units on the scale: Moderate erectile dysfunction 1-7 units on the scale: Severe erectile dysfunction

measure.title: Qmax
measure.description: Maximum urinary flow rate (mL/s) in free uroflowmetry

measure.title: PVRU volume
measure.description: PVRU = postvoid residual urine Postvoid residual urine in the bladder after urination, measured with transvesical ultrasound

measure.title: Urge urinary incontinence with need for drug use (UUIND)
urge Urinary incontinence without the need for drug use (UUIWND)

group.title: M-TURP
group.description: The M-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Olympus or Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (Glycine 1.5%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (ForceTriadTM, Medtronic) and a stainless steel loop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (120W) prostate tissue and cauterize (80W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

group.title: PK-TURP
group.description: The PK-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (NaCl 0.9%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (PlasmaKineticTM Superpulse de Gyrus, ACMI) and a platinum-iridium superloop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (180W) prostate tissue and cauterize (100W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

measure.title: Change in Haemoglobin in 24 Hours Post-operation
measure.description: Compared with the baseline, to demonstrate the blood loss during operation

outcome.title: Transfusion Rate
outcome.description: Number of participants requiring blood transfusion during, expressed in %

outcome.title: Clavien Dindo System
outcome.description: It is a system for evaluating surgical complications at 12 months after surgery. Clavien I Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions. Acceptable therapeutic regimens are drugs as antiemetics, antipyretics, analgesics, diuretics and electrolytes, and physiotherapy. Clavien II Requiring pharmacological treatment with drugs other than such allowed for grade I complications. Blood transfusions and total parenteral nutrition are also included Clavien III - Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention Clavien IV - Life-threatening complication (including central nervous system complications) requiring intensive care unit management Clavien V - Death of a patient

group.title: M-TURP
group.description: The M-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Olympus or Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (Glycine 1.5%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (ForceTriadTM, Medtronic) and a stainless steel loop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (120W) prostate tissue and cauterize (80W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

group.title: PK-TURP
group.description: The PK-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (NaCl 0.9%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (PlasmaKineticTM Superpulse de Gyrus, ACMI) and a platinum-iridium superloop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (180W) prostate tissue and cauterize (100W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

measure.title: Sequelae Rate: Retrograde Ejaculation
measure.description: register the number of retrograde ejaculation at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

outcome.title: Sequelae Rate: Dysuria
outcome.description: register the number of dysuria at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

group.title: M-TURP
group.description: The M-TURP procedure requires the use of a resectoscope (Olympus or Storz, 26Ch), camera system and irrigation fluid (Glycine al 1.5%, Baxter). The system consists of a generator unit (ForceTriadTM, Medtronic) and a stainless steel loop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (120W) prostate tissue and cauterize (80W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

group.title: PK-TURP

The system consists of a generator unit (PlasmaKineticTM Superpulse de Gyrus, ACMI) and a platinum-iridium superloop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (180W) prostate tissue and cauterize (100W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

measure.title: Sequelae Rate: Dysuria
measure.description: register the number of dysuria at 1, 3, 6, and 12 after surgery.

The system consists of a generator unit (PlasmaKineticTM Superpulse de Gyrus, ACMI) and a platinum-iridium superloop with an electrical current running through the loop used to cut (180W) prostate tissue and cauterize (100W). Prostate tissue is cut away in small pieces and removed at the end of the procedure using an Ellik evacuator Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP): Randomized allocation to M-TURP or PK-TURP

event.description: Need for surgery because of residual adenoma, urethral stenosis or bladder neck contracture

event.sub_title: Stenotic events without the need for surgery

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
